channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Odd that the billionaire whose top rated TV host spreads antisemitic conspiracy theories minimizes likely antisemitic motives of July 4 massacre. https://t.co/0aoNwF8FNy
Look who got Perchik‚Äôs fortune cookie! https://t.co/CVtk3UpPbX

Really amazing that the Jewish community is supporting two laws related to hate crime reporting and weeding out neo-Nazis from law enforcement and the Republicans are almost universally opposed and the conversation keeps going back to "left-wing antisemitism."
This bill passed the House on almost straight party lines and died in the face of the Senate's unconstitutional supermajority requirement on straight party lines. https://t.co/LBSQtybPk1
The even less ambitious Khalid Jabara and Heather Heyer National Opposition to Hate, Assault, and Threats to Equality Act, which would incentivize local police departments to report hate crimes, is similarly DOA due to Republican opposition.
It has 90 Democratic an 15 Republican cosponsors in the House; in the Senate, only two of its 24 cosponsors are Republican. https://t.co/nJPabw5Maf
Meanwhile, JFNA says its recent top lobbying priorities were antisemitism and hate crime laws, including these, but their whole press release is a paen to foreign issues and domestic bipartisanship. https://t.co/GZ2bGfy0fl
@nathangoldman @Jacob_Labendz Mazal Tov!
@haaretzcom @trekonomics fyi

@dzkalman @Doc_RPS @DavidRSelis I think it‚Äôs really hard to market something work on the back of one‚Äôs head using classic fashion tropes. A Bulkharian yarmulke, a Fedora, a Shtreimel ‚Äî sure.
@dzkalman @Doc_RPS @DavidRSelis But the implicit message of the ad is that you‚Äôll look like the model if you wear their clothes. Not the same effect if you can‚Äôt get both the head covering and the face in the same shot.
@hyperplanes @trekonomics We Dylan fans know that loud explosives are relatively civilized as American public amusements have historically gone. https://t.co/C8nhd3HEpO
@washingtonpost @DougJBalloon FYI
How I spent a few weeks in eighth grade shop class. https://t.co/nTGf4ffKxN
@keithmo @doctorow @threadandstone1 @BizBlasty @grumpy_matt @jysf @HalvarF @klaatu29 @AKMA Same.
@DavidRSelis We have one. It‚Äôs just been developed by the worst, most Republican-adjacent rabbis.
@jaymichaelson The more interesting question is why the Republican Party and the unelected tyrants on the Supreme Court want to flood this country with military weapons.

Thinking about the science fictional present we‚Äôre living in and, yes, I don‚Äôt care what Gabriel Bell says, such a visual delight is worth the occasional sanctuary district. https://t.co/Y5rRr4EuBd
@babyboymonaghan What year is this from?
Too soon. https://t.co/aTPXbz0nBx

@trekonomics Well, he has at least one contemporary fan, according to his Wikipedia page references: '"A program for a Christian social order : the organic democracy of Ren√© de La Tour du Pin", (2012), Doctoral Dissertation by Joseph F X Sladky, Catholic University of America
@trekonomics A fan who would like to remind us all that "the Social Kingship of Christ was not optional. " https://t.co/6U5anhieEv

So I'm looking at the ADL's "plans" for combatting and extremism and... it seems like more effort was put into flashy acronyms then organizing actual policy ideas. Am I missing something? https://t.co/vSWf9zSqhx
The terror of a gun-drenched society is the point. üßµ https://t.co/MbpsVf1SQx
We need a Museum of Victims of ‚ÄúLibertarianism.‚Äù https://t.co/CAPQqpemD7
@emptywheel We need a Museum of Victims of ‚ÄúLibertarianism.‚Äù
@elivalley And once again you deny hashgacha pratis.
@NesrineMalik @timmaughan Oooh. How big a section? Asking as someone with too many unread books, but also an obsessive interest in Stephens and what he represents.
@RokhlK Not in those words, but the essence of the central teaching of one of Hillel‚Äôs most influential contemporaries. https://t.co/Pl896VArpY

@JeffreyWoolf @Wordsmith_Manda @mominisrael Republicans are now arguing that it‚Äôs meant to stop a federal church but the states can each create their own.
@JeffreyWoolf @Wordsmith_Manda @mominisrael The current Supreme Court is on a mission to roll back a century of liberal jurisprudence even as the Republican Party aligns with the most haredi forms of Christianity.
@Shmarya @dzkalman Makes me wonder if this outfit is legit. https://t.co/Gcr05P56nC
